title: High Vinnalls Walking Route

images.title: Richard Webb / High Vinnalls summit
images.caption: High Vinnalls summit. 375m summit, the highest part of the great limestone ridge running from the Severn at Ironbridge well into Radnorshire. The hut on stilts was a radio relay, it appeared in the late 1970s and was once usable as a bothy.

images.title: Row17 / High Vinnalls Car Park
images.caption: High Vinnalls Car Park. Nice view of the good sized parking area located to the north west of the hill.

images.title: Richard Webb / Cleared block, High Vinnalls
images.caption: Cleared block. Former Sitka block above Climbing Jack Common. Now home to skylarks.

images.title: Richard Webb / Vale of Wigmore, from the High Vinnalls
images.caption: Vale of Wigmore, from the hill summit.

description: Climb to this wonderful viewpoint on this circular walk in Mortimer Forest in Ludlow . It's a challenging climb with the High Vinnalls viewpoint reaching a height of over 1200ft. From the high points there are fabulous panoramic views over the surrounding Herefordshire countryside. This walk uses part of the Mortimer Trail long distance footpath. It starts at the High Vinnalls car park but you could start from Ludlow and follow the Mortimer Trail through the Mary Knoll Valley to reach the hill. To extend your walk you could follow the trail south to Croft Ambrey Hill Fort and woods. You'll also find the magnificent Croft Castle surrounded by 1500 acres of parkland, farmland and woods. Just to the east of the hill you will also find Overton Common and a deer park.
